comment: She isn't understanding or flexible at all when it comes to circumstances/ due dates. She is good at explaining concepts you may not understand though. Definitely don't procrastinate on lab reports/ writing in your notebook because they take a while to do.
shes so funny and makes class fun. if u have questions she will help until you fully understand

The rudest person Ive ever met in KSU. She tends to have some kind of favoritism among students, I made a tiny mistake when measuring a chemical in the first lab of the semester and she treated me like trash for the rest of the semester. Whenever I ask her a question she gets annoyed and irritated so I stopped asking. Never recommending her ever.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Ok, here's the thing, she is such a smart lady. I am definitely inspired by her accomplishments and work ethic, but she is super hard to work with. Her class was relatively easy, but trying to work with her and asking her questions was super nerve wracking and I wasn't very comfortable with her.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Based on these reviews, I was scared to have her. However, she was awesome! The class was in person & straight forward. Its required to write the class the lab out before you come. She helps if you have questions and walk you thru the lab before you start. I would definitely recommend Kristina Garner. P.S she is hilarious and very honest!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Gives good feedback--Hilarious

comment: No extra credit, she doesn't respond to emails, when she does she's barely helpful and is very rude responding to questions in class. if stop asking questions she literally downgrades you in her evaluation, she's not good at explaining either but overall if you study, make a friend in class, use Chegg & quizl you will pass. everything is open book.

She has a very dry sense of humor that you get used to quickly. When you email her, her responses are very vague that do not give much direction, so you are better off asking your peers for help. She wasn't bad, but she wasn't the best either. Not a harsh grader as long you know what you're doing. Drops 1 lab and 2 quizzes.

The weekly quizzes given had no correlation to what we were doing in class. Professor was close to 0 help and it's almost as if you are teaching yourself. She claims to be one of the "most chill" teachers, but that's because she is barely a teacher.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: Her class is pretty straight forward, but she is terrible with providing help, does not give feedback on work, gives weekly quizzes you might know nothing about because she does not make them, and is bad with responding to emails.

Prof Garner helps you with any questions you have during the lab, and she gives helpful tips and reminders. She may come off as a little rude, but thats just how she is. Shes funny and even though she might sass the class at times, she is super helpful and tries to have us all succeed.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria

comment: Shes super understanding and easy to talk to too. I love how relatable she is. She really wants you to make a good grade so she will reopen quizzes. She drops a quiz and lab report. The final was a little hard, so definitely try to learn something over the semester. This class didnt require too much effort besides doing labs at home.

Garner is a bit rude and so was the TA for the semester. On the bright side, she makes lab straightforward and will help you if you're lost. Follow dress code rules and make sure your lab notebook is set up correctly because she is very particular.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: She had a bad attitude, is rude, unwilling to help when you have questions. Class is straightforward but her attitude is the issue because she wont help you, neither does her TA. When you do need help she says to ask but then is really mean.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria

comment: Might be the best chem lab professor. Her content assessments are a little hard, but do the labs, lab reports, and practice the problems and you should be good. She helps you if you have any questions and her lab is pretty straightforward. Just listen to all her rules about lab attire and you will be fine.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring

comment: Professor Garner's class was ok. The labs are straightforward, but make sure you have them done before class. I missed one class due to an emergency that came up. I emailed her and she never got back to me. Instead she put in 3 zeroes for the assignments I missed. I ended up getting a B because of that. During class she will answer questions.
Answered any questions you had during labs. Very patient when students would break something/ in general. Study before class and understand the concepts beforehand for a smoother lab experience.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Clearly explains the lab beforehand and is very helpful with mistakes and questions. Grades fairly on lab reports. Content assessments are difficult and the final was harder than expected considering the fact that all the labs were easy to complete. I finished every lab early, and was usually one of the last ones to do so.

Great teacher however gets irritated a lot when you ask questions during lab. Dress in lab attire and do your notebook for the lab or she is quick to send you home. Grades fairly on lab notebook and lab reports. If you do the work and pay attention you will get an A.

Took her over the summer and it was great being in her class. Has quizzes on D2L and grades/checks notebooks before entering class. Final is mostly over the labs you did so study them and remember what you did and how.

Expected us to be perfect in our attire but "class isn't cancelled if I'm 15 minutes late." Doesn't respond to emails. You can make an A as long as you don't make less than a 60 on the final, but trust me, you probably will. And no curve. I made an 88.
As long as you do the labs the way you are supposed to and finish the reports, you will be fine. I completely failed the final with a 56% and still got an A in the class.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Easy grader who shows and explains how to do everything very clearly. Plus she's like you she wants to get in and out so she helps make the labs quick. Definitely take her!
She will help with anything ! She is not crazy strict on dress code and super easy grader! Never got a B on my lab reports, shes very nice. A great teacher.
I had her for 1151L and 1152L. AMAZING. Very helpful. I still talk to her now for advice about nursing, and programs. Just all around great person, and professor

i loved having this professor! ive taken many other lab courses (bio, anatomy, etc.) and she is the best lab professor i have had. she explains things well, grades fairly, and is willing to work with her students. she's also pretty funny so that made lab more bearable, just dont show up not in dress code because she is quick to send you home
Please take her! She cares about students and will HELP YOU during labs. Weekly quizzes but theyre very easy. Just look at your lab manual!

Organic chem is a hard lab no matter what but this teacher is a funny, great explainer who wants to help her students! She walks around during labs so everyone can be helped. She gives weekly quizzes and checks the lab notebooks at the end of the semester to make sure you are keeping up with them. She is honestly the chillest professor ever!!

Prof. Garner is an excellent lab professor. She explains the lab before you start and is willing to help with questions throughout the lab. There are 6 labs, 6 pre-lab quizzes and 6 content assessments. Her syllabus schedule is very accurate and if you do the labs and assignments (and do pretty well) you'll get at least a B. Highly recommend!

so she taught decent enough, but she does not care to explain the lab portion of things. she did not give the grades back at a decent time frame. Rules are extremely strict and made a lab that should be easy harder than need be. Take someone else.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Professor Garner made my first lab experience fun and enjoyable! She was caring, very helpful, and she would sometimes sit down and talk to us about non-school related things. I'm taking her again for lab next semester for sure!
